solution.text:
\(_{j}_(_{k}_x + _{l}_) = _{m}_ \)
\(\Rightarrow (_{j}_\times_{k}_x) + (_{j}_\times_{l}_) = _{m}_ \) [Using Distributive Law]
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*k}}_x + _{{j*l}}_ = _{m}_ \)
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*k}}_x = _{m}_ - _{{j*l}}_ \) [Taking constant terms to one side]
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*k}}_x = _{{m-(j*l)}}_ \)
Dividing both sides by _{{j*k}}_, we obtain:
\(x =_{{Fraction(m-(j*l),j*k)}}_\)
